body_html:
For Linux with Python 3.6 it worked for me (Arch Linux, CPU and GPU versions) to download the Python 3.5 version and simply rename it (adapting for CPU vs. GPU and tf version used) from 35 to 36 (2x):

Example for CPU version:
mv tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl

followed by

pip install tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl

For Linux with Python 3.6 it worked for me (Arch Linux, CPU and GPU versions) to download the Python 3.5 version and simply rename it (adapting for CPU vs. GPU and tf version used) from 35 to 36 (2x):
Example for CPU version:
mv tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
followed by
pip install tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
body:
For Linux with Python 3.6 it worked for me (Arch Linux, CPU and GPU versions) to download the Python 3.5 version and simply rename it (adapting for CPU vs. GPU and tf version used) from 35 to 36 (2x):

Example for CPU version:
`mv tensorflow-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl`

followed by

`pip install tensorflow-0.12.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl`
